name: Hot Pie
message:
Okay, so you really don’t have a good sense of Westeros or the wider world around you, but that’s okay.
Keep working on your dire wolf bread, your baking may be the key to save the Seven Kingdoms.
You may yet sit the Iron Throne, Hot Pie.
tweet: I’m Hot Pie, my Westeros geography is way worse than my dire wolf loaves. See how you fare.

name: Rickon Stark
message:
Serpentine Rickon! Serpentine!
Oh, Rickon you were taken from us too soon.
You didn’t quite have time to develop a good geographical sense, did you?
tweet: I’m Rickon, what I lack in trivia knowledge, I also lacked in screen time… #Shaggydog was the best direwolf. See how you fare.

name: Khal Drogo
message: Sure you are a powerful horse-lord, and your son would be the Stallion that Mounts the World… but you really haven’t spent much time outside of the Dothraki Sea, have you?
tweet: I’m Khal Drogo. I would have done better if all of the trivia questions were about horses. See how you fare.

name: Theon Greyjoy
message:
So you know your way around a bit.
While getting tortured you could certainly name some of the great keeps of The North.
But you definitely lack some geographic sense…
You should have listened to Yara when she told you that Winterfell was too far from the sea…
tweet: I’m Theon. I’ve been around enough to have some knowledge of the world, but I still screw it up quite a bit. See how you fare.

name: Robb Stark
message:
Your understanding of Westerosi geography has its ups and downs.
You are smart enough to use the terrain to trick your opponents and win battles, only to insult the man who controls the only bridge between you and home… cue The Rains of Castamere
tweet: I’m Robb. I had a good run… but I probably could have done better. Hey, do you want to come to my wedding? See how you fare.

name: Davos Seaworthy
message:
Decades of smuggling followed by years hanging out with Stannis around that giant map table on Dragonstone have given you a good head for geography!
Still, I think you could do better, Onion Knight.
tweet: I’m Davos, I know loads about the secret passages and canals of the kingdom, just don’t ask me to read the questions for you. See how you fare.

name: Arya Stark
message:
You’ve studied courtliness in Winterfell as a child, water dancing with a First Sword of Braavos, and the art of death with the Faceless Men.
It seems you must have picked up some geography on your travels as well!
tweet: I’m Arya. A girl has travelled the world and learned much. Valar Morghulis. See how you fare.

name: Daenerys Targaryen
message:
Not only are you one of the most well-travelled people in all the known world, as Mother of Dragon’s you get to take in the scenery from the best seat in the house.
Who needs a map when you have Drogon?
tweet: I’m Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, First of Her Name, the Unburnt, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains, and Mother of Dragons, and my trivia is on point. See how you fare.

name: Samwell Tarly
message: With all the maps in Horn Hill, Castle Black, and probably a good number of those in The Citadel in Oldtown committed to memory, you really know your way around Westeros and Essos!
tweet: I’m Sam. I know almost everything about Westeros and Essos. They won’t let me play during Castle Black Trivia Night anymore. See how you fare.

name: The Three-eyed Raven
message:
You must be a Greenseer.
That is the only way to explain how you seem to know the location and details of every castle, city, village, and landmark from Sunspear to the The Shadowlands beyond Asshai.
tweet: I’m The Three Eyed Raven, I can see all that has been and all that is. No trivia can fool me. See how you fare.
